item.title: The Elder Scrolls 6 Can Follow Avowed's Example to Shake Up Its Formula
item.description:
The Elder Scrolls 6 can change up its formula by incorporating an idea based on what Avowed is doing with its player characters. With The Elder Scrolls being the venerable RPG series that it is, it's a little unusual to picture it following another game's lead. However, Avowed has an idea that could prove useful for The Elder Scrolls 6 to follow up on in its own way. The two games are bound to have a whole world of differences in many areas. Even with that in mind, The Elder Scrolls 6 could learn from Avowed .

Considering that Avowed has already been compared to Skyrim , it would be little surprise if it was eventually likened to The Elder Scrolls 6 as well. While there is still very little that is known about The Elder Scrolls 6 , it's very likely that it will be fairly similar to Skyrim in more than a few ways. On the other hand, Avowed 's gameplay is largely public knowledge by now. Naturally, its first-person fantasy gameplay featuring spells and swords drew comparisons to Skyrim , with a few twists. Once Avowed comes out, players will find out how similar it truly is to Skyrim .

The Elder Scrolls 6 Might Benefit From a Look at Avowed's Skill Trees

Avowed's Skill System Is Essentially a Multiclass System

One interesting mechanic worth watching is Avowed 's new skill system. It has a set of skills separated into various classes, each focuses on a specific kind of gameplay. For example, Fighter skills are focused on making characters better at melee combat, Wizard skills improve spellcasting ability, and so on. It's not a true class system, since players are free to mix-and-match skills as they please. However, it still gives clear archetypes that players can follow. Avowed players can go all in on one class, or diversify their character's skills to give themselves more options. This approach should offer plenty of viable character builds.

The Elder Scrolls 6 Can Experiment With Starting Classes

The Elder Scrolls 6 could offer its own take on the idea. When creating a character in The Elder Scrolls 6 , giving players the option to choose their class at the start could give them a few immediate bonuses. For example, Mages could get a larger starting mana pool, while thieves get a stealth bonus and a slight speed increase. However, after leveling up a couple of times, the game could open up to grant players access to skills based in other classes or disciplines. The result would be a character with a strong base, but the ability to have a flexible skillset.

Avowed players can go all in on one class, or diversify their character's skills to give themselves more options.

The Elder Scrolls 6 Can Have the Series' Best Character Creator

This design would also be a good way to branch off from past Elder Scrolls character creation systems. While choosing a race in Skyrim was the only way to augment the Dragonborn's skills before their first level-up, other features like Oblivion 's birthsigns have offered unique bonuses as well. Even Skyrim itself had several skill trees to grab perks from. However, if The Elder Scrolls 6 features classes with innate abilities combined with skill trees, it could have the best of both worlds. The combination could result in players having good reason to make a lot of different characters to experiment with.

Avowed has some good ideas, and The Elder Scrolls 6 can have its own version of some of those concepts. The eventual release of The Elder Scrolls 6 is going to be an event no matter what. Not only will it finally continue the series after Skyrim became a cultural phenomenon, but it will also show the series' next evolution. Of course, its protagonist will be a big part of that. There's a chance that Avowed could be something of an inspiration for The Elder Scrolls 6 in that sense.

item.title: Love And Deepspace: All Active Redeem Codes (July 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Love And Deepspace Redeem Codes For July 2024
  • How To Redeem Love And Deepspace Codes
  • How To Acquire More Empyrean Wishes in Love And Deepspace

Love and Deepspace is an Otome game that blends RPG battles into its mechanics. Players will come across several love interests to spend time with, and they can bring their significant other to fight against enemies in the set universe. The power of the players' companions is dictated by the character's card, which can be obtained through the gacha system. On top of enhancing players' battle experience, these acquired cards also serve to unlock special moments with the in-game characters.

Acquiring cards from limited banners can be challenging, making redeeming codes a valuable resource for Deepspace Hunters seeking their favorite character's card. For an up-to-date list of working Love and Deepspace redeem codes , you can refer to this article.

Updated on July 14, 2024, by Nahda Nabiilah: With the release of the Love and Deepspace Version 2.0 Opposing Visions, Infold released some new redeem codes to celebrate the occasion alongside its Hunters. One of the redemption codes offers players a 10 Empyrean Wish, that they can use to wish on the Xspace Echo banner. Moreover, the new version will include new stories, new features, new events, new free outfits, and the addition of one of the most anticipated new love interests, Sylus.

Love And Deepspace Redeem Codes For July 2024

These are the Love and Deepspace codes for July 2024:

Love and Deepspace Codes

Rewards

20240715

  • 10 Empyrean Wish

DEEPSPACE2

  • 200 Diamonds
  • 200 Stamina
  • 20,000 Gold

FLYHIGH

  • Snowing Skyline (Photo Item)
  • Skysoaring Bunny (Photo Item)
  • Gleaming Skyline (Photo Item)
  • Blazing Skyline (Photo Item)
  • Wishsending Fishie (Photo Item)
  • Cloudcleaving Seal stickers (Photo Item)

Love And Deepspace Expired Codes

Unfortunately, some of the released codes have a limit and Deepspace Hunters cannot acquire their rewards anymore. The following redeem codes are no longer available:

  • ZONGZI.
  • KEEPLYSK.
  • 100DAYS.
  • LOVEDEEP8888.
  • LOVEDEEP1004.
  • LnDxUki.
  • LnDxIke.
  • 520EVERYDAY.
  • 2024WOMENSDAY.
  • TIEDUP.
  • 100000FOLLOW.
  • LnDxLuca.
  • LnDxFulgur.
  • 3DLOVE.
  • love2024.
  • DEEPSPACE2024.
  • LOVEDEEP486.

How To Redeem Love And Deepspace Codes

To redeem Love and Deepspace codes, Hunters must:

  1. Complete Chapter 1: To Begin.
  2. Tap your avatar in the screen's upper-right corner from the main menu.
  3. Click the settings icon in the bottom-right corner of the screen.
  4. Press more .
  5. Choose the redeem code option.
  6. Enter the redeemable codes.
  7. Press exchange to acquire the promised rewards.

How To Acquire More Empyrean Wishes in Love And Deepspace

Empyrean Wishes are the tickets Deepspace Hunters use to Wish on the Xspace Echo and Rippling Echo banners to pull their favorite characters' Memories.

For New Deepspace Hunters

New Deepspace Hunters can acquire Empyrean Wishes by doing the following:

  • Complete Chapter 1: To Begin to unlock the Mailbox. Once unlocked, Hunters will find 34 Empyrean Wishes and 300 Diamonds inside as a gift for downloading the game, pre-registering, and reaching 10 million downloads globally.
  • Collect 650 City Badges during the onboard time-limited event to earn 10 Empyrean Wishes, 520 Diamonds, Zayne: Surprise Encounter Memory, and an SSR Memory of your adored character.
  • Reach level 55 to acquire 40 Empyrean Wishes.
  • Sign in for 7 days to Love and Deepspace during the 7 Days Art Cruise event to earn 20 Empyrean Wishes, Rafayel: Myths Memory, 200 Stamina, 500 Diamonds, and 100k Gold.
  • Reach Level 60 in Heartfelt Vow to get 12 Empyrean Wishes. To raise its level, complete the Promise's Tasks in the game's task menu.

For Veteran Deepspace Hunters

Frequent players can collect Empyrean Wishes by:

  • Login every day.
  • Completing their daily tasks.
  • Participate in the newly released events.
  • Leveling-up and ranking-up their Memories.
  • Bypassing the bosses' battles and Open Orbit challenges.
  • Completing the By Your Side and Falling for You side stories.
  • Acquiring the rewards of the unhidden and hidden achievements in Love and Deepspace .

Upon obtaining any SSR Memory, players can experience this card's Memoria or Myths in a 3D interactive mode in the Falling for You section of the Date menu. Meanwhile, SR Memories delves into the card's storyline by unlocking the charactersâ€™ voice lines in the By Your Side section of the Date Menu.

Love and Deepspace is now available on Android.

item.title: Awesome Clip Shows How Much Stealth Has Improved in Starfield
item.description:
Highlights

  • Starfield's stealth gameplay has been significantly improved since its release.
  • These refinements have recently been illustrated in some fan-made gameplay footage showing how sneaking is now much easier, whereas sneak attacks trigger more consistently.

One Starfield fan has recently taken to social media to praise Bethesda for improving the RPG's stealth gameplay, substantiating that observation with some new footage from the game. The brief clip helps illustrate how Starfield 's stealth mechanics have been refined since its release.

One of the major Starfield complaints that the game's fandom voiced at launch was that sneaking around was extremely difficult. Those grievances were largely aimed at enemies' ability to spot the player from extreme distances, sometimes even "seeing" them through walls or other types of cover. Bethesda has so far made several attempts to address those complaints.

Fan Illustrates How Starfield Stealth Is Much More Forgiving Nowadays

While it remains to be seen whether the company is done refining the game's sneaking mechanics, its efforts on this front have already yielded some palpable results. This was recently noted by Reddit user TurnipTate, who shared a clip illustrating some of the observable improvements in Starfield 's stealth mechanics. The video begins with their character running down a corridor before crouching down at an intersection, with their footsteps making a guard around the corner grow suspicious, but not outright hostile. This turn of events would virtually never happen in the early versions of the game, which featured enemies with near-superhuman senses.

A later portion of TurnipTate's clip also illustrates how Starfield 's sneak attacks are now much more consistent, predictably triggering so long as the player remains undiscovered. According to them, the current version of the game's stealth system now only has one big issue that's yet to be resolved, which concerns companion interactions with enemies. Namely, should a companion enter combat, the player will sometimes be unable to perform sneak attacks, even if they themselves haven't been discovered.

Bethesda's Been Improving Starfield Stealth Since Late 2023

Some of the newly exemplified stealth improvements have been in the game for a while now, dating back to the Starfield update 1.8.86, which rolled out in late November 2023. That release saw Bethesda adjust the game's sneaking mechanics in order to make them "a bit more forgiving," according to the developer's official changelog.

Several more improvements have been released since then, with the most recent of the lot arriving as part of the Starfield update 1.10.31, which launched in mid-March 2024. That patch fixed an annoying bug that would occasionally cause Minibots to mess with the in-game Stealth Meter. Players who still find sneaking around to be too hard also have the option to utilize some of the game's many stealth mods. One such particularly popular community creation is the Stealth Overhaul mod. Developed by Nexus Mods user IxionXVII, this add-on has been downloaded nearly 215,000 times since its September 2023 release.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: W-Engine (Weapon) Tier List
item.description:
The following tier list ranks the best W-Engines in Zenless Zone Zero based on their Types: Attack, Anomaly, Stun, Defense, and Support. Before diving into the list, there are a couple of important points to consider. Firstly, W-Enginesâ€™ effects only work on Agents with the same Type (Specialty) and Attribute, making a general tier list impractical. Therefore, this tier list has been divided into five categories to better rank each Typeâ€™s best options. Secondly, this list excludes battle pass W-Engines and weapons with niche buffs (e.g., those that enhance one specific Attribute), because the goal is to identify all-around practical weapons for players.

With that in mind, here are Zenless Zone Zero â€™s most effective W-Engines in each class.

Attack W-Engine Tier List

ATK W-Engine Tier

Best Models

S

The Brimstone and Cannon Rotor

A

Steel Cushion and Starlight Engine

B

Street Superstar

  • S-Tier : The Brimstone is one of the best W-Engines for all Attack Specialty Agents because it benefits from the equipperâ€™s Basic Attack, Dash Attack, and Dodge Counter to buff DMG. Cannon Rotor, meanwhile, offers an easy-to-trigger 12% ATK buff on top of a 200% extra DMG after CRIT hits.
  • A-Tier : Steel Cushion is a safe option because it provides up to 50% DMG for any attack from behind. It also provides up to 40% Physical DMG for the user. Starlight Engine is another reliable choice because it feeds off Dodge Counter or Quick Assist, two frequent combat moves, to buff ATK.
  • B-Tier : The Street Superstar is the ideal stopgap. It gives the Agent a Charge stack every time a team member lands a Chain Attack.

Stun W-Engine Tier List

ATK W-Engine Tier

Best Models

S

The Restrained and Precious Fossilized Core

A

Hellfire Gears and Six Shooter

B

Steam Oven and [Vortex] Hatchet

  • S-Tier : The Restrained is the best Stun W-Engine since it boosts the Daze and DMG of Basic Attacks. Precious Fossilized Core is another practical weapon, as it can provide up to 32% Daze.
  • A-Tier : Hellfire Gears comes with a passive and active effect that are both practical. Off-field, it accelerates Energy Regen. On-field, it can enhance the userâ€™s Impact effect by up to 20% (for each EX Special Attack that they land).
  • B-Tier : Steam Oven and [Vortex] Hatchet are consistent early-game choices because they offer easy-to-trigger Impact buffs.

Anomaly W-Engine Tier List

ATK W-Engine Tier

Best Models

S

Fusion Compiler and Electro-Lip Gloss

A

Rainforest Gourmet and Roaring Ride

B

Weeping Gemini

  • S-Tier : Fusion Compiler is a top-tier W-Engine in that it comes with a base ATK boost that benefits all Anomaly Agents. It also feeds off Special Attack or EX Special Attack to accelerate Anomaly Proficiency, a critical stat for the Anomaly Specialty. Electro-Lip Gloss is another good choice thanks to its ATK and DMG buff against Attribute Anomaly-infected enemies.
  • A-Tier : Rainforest Gourmet and Roaring Ride are the runner-up best W-Engines, as they both come with ATK buffs. Roaring Ride can also enhance Anomaly Proficiency and Buildup Ratio, which are essential in combat.
  • B-Tier : Weeping Gemini is perfect for early-game Anomaly compositions, as it provides a reliable source for Anomaly Proficiency.

Support W-Engine Tier List

ATK W-Engine Tier

Best Models

S

Slice of Time and Weeping Cradle

A

The Reverb Series (Mark 1, 2, and 3)

B

Kaboom the Cannon

  • S-Tier : Among all Support W-Engines, Slice of Time and Weeping Cradle are the best as they provide team-wide buffs.
  • A-Tier : The Reverb Series W-Engines are a surefire pick for players who want to capitalize on their Support Agentâ€™s combat skills.
  • B-Tier : Kaboom the Cannon is also perfect for Support characters, as it boosts the teamâ€™s ATK when the player lands successful shots or strikes.

Defense W-Engine Tier List

ATK W-Engine Tier

Best Models

S

Bunny Band and Original Transmorpher

A

Spring Embrace and Big Cylinder

B

[Identity] Base

  • S-Tier : With Bunny Band and Original Transmorpher, your Tank agents get the highest durability, allowing you to exploit their presence.
  • A-Tier : Spring Embrace and Big Cylinder are the next best options, thanks to their properties that reduce the enemyâ€™s inflicted DMG.
  • B-Tier : With [Identity] Base, you can enhance a Tankâ€™s DEF in a passive way without having to do any on-field triggering activities.

item.title: What The Involvement of Resident Evil 7's Director Could Mean For RE9
item.description:
The Resident Evil franchise has seen its fair share of talented developers come and go over the years. Naturally, some of the most fondly remembered Resident Evil devs are those credited with directing some of the most beloved entries in franchise history, with Resident Evil 1 and 4 director Shinji Mikami, and Resident Evil 2 director Hideki Kamiya both being legendary names in the gaming industry all these years later.

There have been a total of eight mainline Resident Evil releases since 1996, and over 20 spinoffs or remakes, and the vast majority of these projects have each been helmed by someone new. But in a rare turn of events, it's just been confirmed that Resident Evil 7 's director, Koshi Nakanishi, is returning to direct the next mainline installment of the franchise. Nakanishi actually has a few Resident Evil titles under his belt, and they might give fans some clues about what they can expect from Resident Evil 9 .

What Koshi Nakanishi Can Bring to Resident Evil 9

Koshi Nakanishi's Past Work on the Resident Evil Franchise

When it comes to Resident Evil directors, few have been quite as prolific as Koshi Nakanishi. While most Resident Evil directors helm one or two projects, Koshi Nakanishi has already directed a total of three Resident Evil games, with his fourth now officially confirmed to be in development. The first Resident Evil game Koshi Nakanishi worked on was 2009's Resident Evil 5 , where he's credited as being one of the game's designers.

Just two years later, Koshi Nakanishi would be given the reins to his very own Resident Evil title, this time being the 3DS-exclusive Resident Evil: The Mercenaries 3D . While Resident Evil: The Mercenaries 3D wasn't a fully-fledged RE game, it was a pretty impressive 3DS game and a solid debut at the helm for Nakanishi. But just two years later, Nakanishi would get to flex his directing muscles, leading the charge on Resident Evil: Revelations , a critically acclaimed and often overshadowed entry that hearkened back to the series' roots during a time when the franchise was creeping further away from that with each new entry.

After proving himself with Mercenaries 3D and Revelations , Koshi Nakanishi was given the reins to the next mainline entry in the franchise. After the dismal reception of Resident Evil 6 , there was a lot of pressure on Nakanishi to get the franchise back on course, and Resident Evil 7 did just that, bringing the series back to its survival horror roots while still offering fans something new with its first-person perspective and terrifying new threat.

How Resident Evil 9 Could Be Influenced by Koshi Nakanishi's Past Work

With three great Resident Evil projects already under his belt, Koshi Nakanishi is more than qualified to helm the next mainline Resident Evil entry. In his recent announcement, Nakanishi stated that he struggled to find a direction for the series after Resident Evil 7 , but he's now found it, and according to him, it "feels substantial." Though fans shouldn't read too much into this one quote, it does suggest that the series could be heading in a bold new direction, though some of Nakanishi's staples are likely to carry over regardless.

One of the most common praises of both Resident Evil: Revelations and Resident Evil 7 was the games' excellent use of claustrophobic spaces, capturing the oppressive atmosphere of the original games and emphasizing the survival part of "survival horror." According to some recent rumors, Resident Evil 9 could be going open-world, which would be antithetical to Nakashini's previous game structures, though fans can probably still expect RE9 to embrace the series' roots just as Nakanishi's past games have.
